answers.answer: I am sorry for both you and your pet. Diabetes can be very tricky to get the insulin dosage right. Obviously Batman is excessively thirsty, which makes me wonder if his insulin dosage is correct. If you trust the Vet you are taking him too, then continue to take him in until he is better ... or you can also take him to another Vet and get a second opinion, which is always a good thing if in doubt. I do wish you both the very best, take care!
Thank you so much 4s for your comment.  I think I will take him to another vet for a second opinion.  Thanks for responding.

I agree definitely getting a second opinion couldn't hurt. I have a dog that b/c of the side effects of a number of the meds he is on has urination issues as well that can not be helped so we actually set up a wee wee pad system and that seems to help. good luck, i know how frustrating it can be.

Thank you so very much!  Yes, I have Batman on some Pee Pee pads as well, but its the urinating out of control that has me worried.  I'm going to try another vet soon.  Thanks again to you both for answering and helping.  I'll fill you all in when I get some answers.

question: My dog (4 years old 13 lb Full Chihuahua - not a toy Chihuahua) was diagnosed with diabetes about a month ago.  His urination was out of control, then when he started on insulin shots twice a day, he started urinating less.  Then he started urinating out of control again, and his inuslin was upped from 2.5 ml to 3 ml.  He is once again urinating out of control.  I can't seem to get a decent nights sleep unless I kick him out of my bed (which I hate doing since he's slept with me at the foot of my bed since he was a baby).  I can't seem to get any straight answers from the vet over why he is urinating more.  Does his increased urination mean that he needs MORE insulin or LESS insulin?  Does it mean that I need to watch his diet more?  I need some help and answers.  Thank you!  ~ Batman's Mommy
title: URINATION OUT OF CONTROL
